Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Preface Who This Review Is For

Stage Results A RallyDataJunkie Adventure Tony Hirst Last generated on 22 January, 2022 Preface Automatically generated stage timing and results for stages on Rallye Monte-Carlo, 2022. Based on analysis of timing and results data downloaded from the WRC website. To discuss / critique / comment on these analyses, please use the discussion forum. For a guide to the code used to generate the stage reports, see Visualising WRC Rally Results. See also Visualising WRC Rally Stages. This report is unofficial and is not associated in any way with the Fédération Internationale de l’Automobile (FIA) or WRC Promoter GmbH. Who This Review Is For The RallyDataJunkie project, such as it is, is a personal exploration of various ways of representing and visualising rally related stage, timing and results data. There are several potential audiences: rally fans, looking for summaries of rally events; teams and crews, looking for variously arranged summaries to check and compare performances; commentators and journalists, looking for variously arranged summaries and overviews as a tool for confirming or identifying storypoints; data folk, looking for various ways of representing various route, timing or results data.

Note that the stage position is based on the positions given by WRC Live Timing. If two drivers record the same time (or at least, same time to a tenth of a second), only one of them will have position==1 and the other will be position==2. Pace relative to the stage winner. 1.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 1.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 2.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 3.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives Chart Pace relative to the stage winner. 5.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives EVA took second place on stage, 2.3s behind the stage winner and moved up one place to second overall. NEU took third place on stage, 4.7s behind LOE in a time of 661.5s and moved up two places to fourth overall. TÄN took fourth on stage, with a time of 662.4s and moved up one place to sixth overall, just 0.9s off NEU. KAT was in fifth on stage, 12.1s behind stage winner LOE in a time of 668.9s . BRE was in sixth on stage, 1.0s behind KAT . OGI was in seventh on stage, with a time of 672.6s and dropped two places to lose the overall lead, falling back to third overall. GRE was in ninth on stage, 24.3s behind the stage winner in a time of 681.1s dropped three places to seventh overall and just 0.5s further behind OGI. ROV was in eleventh place on stage, with a time of 692.2s and moved up one place to ninth overall and just 0.5s further back behind GRE. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 6.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times OGI was in second place on stage, 2.9s further back behind LOE . EVA was in third on stage, 1.0s behind OGI . GRE was in fourth on stage, 1.0s behind EVA . These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 7.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times Pace relative to the stage winner. 8.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 8.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times NEU was in second on stage, 1.5s behind stage winner OGI . TÄN was in third on stage, 3.4s behind the stage winner in a time of 635.0s and moved up one place to fifth overall. LOE was in fourth on stage, with a time of 636.1s kept hold of the overall lead of the rally. KAT took fifth place on stage, 5.7s behind stage winner OGI in a time of 637.3s . ROV took sixth place on stage, 7.0s behind the stage winner . BRE was in seventh position on stage, 2.5s behind ROV dropped one place to sixth overall. EVA was in eighth position on stage, 11.3s behind OGI in a time of 642.9s . SOL was in ninth on stage, 1.0s behind EVA . relative to the stage winner. 9.1.6 Ultimate Stage Comparisons Split time comparisons relative to various ultimate stage time calculations. These views provide various ways of comparing the performance of each driver to various ghost drivers: best recorded split time at each split (ultimate actuals): gives an estimate of how well the driver’s split times compare with each first ranked split time (time into stage at each split); fastest time going from one split to the next (ultimate sections): gives an estimate of how quickly each driver completed each split section relative to the quickest time recorded completing that split section (time taken to go from one split point to the next); accumulated ultimate sections times: gives and estimate of how quickly the driver is going relative to the fastest possible completion of the stage based on accumulated ultimate split section times. 9.1.6.1 Ultimate Actuals Driver times ROV took second on stage, 0.7s behind EVA , only 0.7s further back behind EVA. OGI took third place on stage, 3.2s further back behind ROV . NEU took fourth on stage, 5.0s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 557.8s . BRE took fifth position on stage, 1.1s further back behind NEU and moved up one place to fifth overall. KAT was in sixth place on stage, 6.3s behind stage winner EVA in a time of 559.1s and moved up one place to seventh overall, just 0.2s further back behind BRE. LOE took seventh place on stage, with a time of 560.1s and retained overall lead. GRE was in eighth on stage, with a time of 560.4s and moved up one place to sixth overall, just 0.3s further behind LOE. SOL was in ninth on stage, 8.3s further back behind GRE . TÄN took tenth position on stage dropped three places to eighth overall, with a time of 629.6s, well back on SOL, who was 60.9s faster. 9.3 Driver Report, SS9 - OGI OGI took third place on stage, 3.2s further back behind ROV .
